channel.title: Services on EcoQuants
channel.description: Recent content in Services on EcoQuants
channel.copyright: Except where otherwise noted, content is under CC License.

item.title: Analysis
item.description:
We are fans of the data science process as outlined by Hadley Wickham in R for Data Science:

Usually most of the work in modeling is at the data preparation and interpretation stages, ie before and after modeling. I’m an advocate of efficient data ingestion (estimated 50-80%spent on collection and preparation of data), the iterative process of exploratory data analysis and closing the gap between the starting with a question and sharing analytical results online and interactively to any audience.

item.title: Development
item.description: We rapidly develop interactive data driven web applications, particularly those with complexity in space, time and taxa. We employ technologies such as Shiny ® and Jupyter (Python), as well as Google App and Earth Engines. We can facilitate hosting these applications in the cloud, and scale resources as needed.

item.title: Training
item.description:
We teach at the intersection of spatial analysis, ecology and data science.

Courses

  • Instructor for Geographic Information Systems (GIS) at UCSB, Spring 2016
  • Instructor for Environmental Informatics at UCSB, Winter 2016
  • Instructor for Advanced Topics in GIS at UCSB, Fall 2014+2015
  • Instructor for Landscape Ecology at UCSB, Winter 2015
  • Instructor for Marine Geospatial Analysis at Duke, Spring 2012
  • Lab Instructor for Conservation Planning at UCSB, Winter 2011
  • Teaching Assistant for Advanced Geospatial Analysis at Duke, Fall 2010
  • Teaching Assistant for Marine Geospatial Analysis at Duke, Spring 2009

Workshops

  • Geospatial Analysis using R Data Carpentry workshop at Lawrence Berkeley National Lab, September 2017
  • Network Science Boot Camp at UCSB, September 2016
  • Reproducible Research using R Software Carpentry workshop at UCSB, April 2016
  • NEON Hackathon: spatio-temporal data lesson-building: created visualization lessons, at Boulder CO, October 2015

Community

There are a lot of great data science / R / environmental informatics community meetups in the Santa Barbara area:

  • Santa Barbara R Users Group: community R ~1x/qrtr
  • Santa Barbara Data Science: community big data ~1x/qrtr
  • Data Science at UCSB: UCSB undergraduate seminars ~2x/qrtr
  • UCSB Data Science: UCSB graduate learning ~1x/2 wk
  • Eco Data Science: Bren/NCEAS graduate learning ~3x/qrtr
